page.title: 17Shopping in Kidderminster 2
page.content: People in Kidderminster do not always do their shopping in the Town Centre. {Local shops}often provide enough variety to cater for general requirements. The new{Franche Co-op supermarket,opened in 1984, makes food shopping in the north of Kidderminster easier. Smaller supermarkets are situated in the{Ferndale}and{Marlpool} areas too. The{Comberton Hill}area, near the station has a string of shops including a Post Office, a bakery, a hardware shop as well as several restaurants and take-away food shops. {Specialist shops}are also found away from the Town Centre. There is a large music shop and a bookshop in the {Comberton Hill}area. The{Horsefair}has a record shop,fancy dress shop and a pet shop, while fishing tackle, motor parts and glasses can be bought at other places in the Town.
